Package com.andybaba.games.card

Interface Hand

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Card>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseHand 
    public interface Hand
extends java.lang.Iterable<Card>
    Interface for hand, it is expected that the class implementing this interface should create a hand with a specific number of slots for Cards to be added later
    Since:
    Dec 13 2018
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Andy

      • randomize

        void randomize​(int count)
        throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Adds a specific number of random Cards to the hand
        Parameters:
        count - The number of cards to be randomize and added to a hand
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the count is more than remaining slots in a hand

      • add

        void add​(Card card)
  throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Adds the given card to the hand
        Parameters:
        card - the Card to be added to the hand
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the hand does not have any empty slots for the given card

   throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

        Parameters:
        index - the position of the card to be shown
        Returns:
        The Card at the given index
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is pointing to and empty slot or out of size

      • contains

        boolean contains​(Card card)
        Checks if the hand contains a given Card. It returns true at its first occurrence
        Parameters:
        card - The Card to look for
        Returns:
        true if it finds the card in the hand

      • count

        The current count of Cards in the hand.
        Returns:

      • maxSize

        int maxSize()
        The maximum count of Cards a hand can hold.
        Returns:
        Maximum number of cards a hand can hold

      • hasDuplicates

        int hasDuplicates()
        If a hand has no duplicates Cards it returns 0, otherwise it will return the number of duplicate occurrences in the hand
        Returns:
        Number of duplicate occurrences in the hand
